brief_summary.textblock:
The overall aim is to study the multiple factors determining the variation of weight loss
      after Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass surgery (RYGB). The specific aims are to evaluate a) what
      explains the large individual differences in weight loss seen after RYGB surgery, b) if it
      is possible pre-operatively to identify which patients will not obtain beneficial effects of
      bariatric surgery in relation to weight loss and quality of life and c) if patients in need
      of improved care can be identified pre- and/or early post-operatively.

clinical_study.brief_title: Weight Loss Following Gastric Bypass Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients approved for bariatric surgery at Bariatric Clinic, Køge  Hospital,
             Denmark

          -  fasting insulin = 17mU/L or fasting insulin > 17mU/L

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Inability to comply with the study protocol

clinical_study.official_title: Patient Profiling for Successful Weight Loss After Gastric Bypass Surgery

authority: Denmark: Danish National Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 month preoperatively, 1 week preoperatively, 6 weeks postoperatively, 6 month postoperatively and 18 month postoperatively

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
